title: Hero background URL update, post-submission follow-ups wiring, and documented smoke test

requirements.summary: Update homepage hero background to use the provided direct URL with bottom-justified cover sizing and a 25% dark-blue overlay plus solid-color fallback.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero background uses the exact provided URL (not a local /assets/ path).
Hero background uses cover sizing and is bottom-justified (equivalent to CSS background-position: center bottom).
A dark-blue overlay is rendered above the image at 25% opacity (0.25), matching the existing dark-blue color used in the hero overlay.
If the image fails to load, the UI still renders with a reasonable solid-color fallback (no broken layout).

file_operations.description: Replace the hero background image source with the exact user-provided direct URL, keep backgroundPosition as center bottom and backgroundSize as cover, preserve the existing dark-blue overlay color while setting its opacity to exactly 0.25, and keep/verify the solid-color fallback behavior when image preloading fails.

requirements.summary: After proposal submission, guide the user directly into the newly created proposal and ensure proposals data refreshes without reload, enabling access to existing instance-dependent follow-ups.
acceptanceCriteria: After a successful instance proposal submission, the app provides an explicit next-step action (English UI text) that takes the user directly to the newly created proposal in the proposals browsing flow.
The proposals list reflects the newly submitted proposal without requiring a full page reload (react-query invalidation/refresh behavior is wired and verified).
From the newly created proposal detail view, the user can reach the instance-dependent follow-up UI that already exists (e.g., the issue project/tasks flow) for that proposal/instance identifier.
No navigation relies on editing immutable hook files; changes are implemented via component composition and safe props/state changes in editable files.

file_operations.description: Add an explicit post-success next-step action (e.g., a button with English text like "View your proposal") to guide the user into the proposal they just submitted; capture the submitted proposal identifier from the mutation result and call a new optional callback prop so App can reveal the proposals browsing UI and preselect/open the new proposal. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing (shadcn-ui Button/Alert patterns already used here).

Wire the post-submission follow-up navigation by passing a callback into CreateInstancePlaceholderCard that (1) opens the Browse Proposals section, (2) scrolls to it, and (3) passes the just-created proposal name down so the Proposal Detail dialog can be opened without manual refresh/navigation.

Support an externally-provided "proposal to open" signal (via a new optional prop) that, once proposals data is available, selects and opens ProposalDetailDialog for that proposal; ensure this does not require a full reload and works with react-query refresh/invalidation behavior. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing (shadcn-ui Card/Button/Dialog patterns already used here).

requirements.summary: Manually smoke test the end-to-end flow (proposal creation through instance-dependent follow-ups) and record steps/results in a repo document.
acceptanceCriteria: A new markdown doc is added under frontend/docs/ (or an existing appropriate docs location) describing the exact manual steps used to validate the chain end-to-end and the observed result for each step.

Smoke test covers: creating/submitting an instance proposal, verifying it appears in Browse Proposals, opening Proposal Detail, performing at least one instance-dependent follow-up action reachable from that detail flow (e.g., opening the Issue Project and creating/completing a task if available), and confirming the UI updates as expected.
Any failures discovered during the smoke test are fixed as part of this build, or clearly documented in the test doc as known remaining issues with reproduction steps.

file_operations.description: Document the exact manual smoke test steps and observed results for the full chain: submit a proposal, confirm it appears in Browse Proposals without page reload, open Proposal Detail, open the Issue Project from that detail flow, and perform at least one task action (create and/or toggle complete) verifying UI updates; include any remaining known issues with repro steps if not fixed.
